rows.SERIES PRODUCER — THE CREATIVE PM: Not a startup PM. A series producer. Someone who thinks in seasons, episodes, and story arcs.
WHY A SERIES PRODUCER
This project IS a series. The IonWave launch IS a show.
The MC IS the host. The cast page IS the cast. The daily updates ARE episodes.
The expert conversations ARE interviews. The milestones ARE plot points.
A startup PM thinks in sprints, tickets, and standups.
A series producer thinks in seasons, episodes, story arcs, and audience.
We need the series producer because:
• The MC needs a producer (someone who preps them, reviews footage, gives notes)
• The content needs a story arc (not just random conversations — a narrative)
• The site needs editorial direction (what goes up, in what order, how it's framed)
• The cast page needs casting direction (who gets featured, how, when)
• The daily updates need production value (not just raw video — edited, graded, titled)
This person is the PM co-founder for CL-0 (Thesis & Meta)
but they're also the creative director for the entire series.
WHAT THEY OWN
• Overall narrative arc: What is the story? How does it unfold over weeks?
• Episode planning: Which MC conversations happen when? What order?
• MC management: Prep, notes, feedback. Making the MC better every day.
• Content calendar: What goes on the site, when, how it's sequenced.
• Production quality: Ensuring cinematic quality across all video content.
• Cast management: Onboarding new cast members into the narrative.
• Audience awareness: What are people watching? What's engaging? What's not?
• Story Bible: The master document that tracks characters, arcs, themes.
They do NOT own:
• Business model production (that's PM co-founders per cluster)
• Admin (that's the admin)
• Expert coordination (that's PM co-founders)
• Fundraising (that's Nilo + CoS)
WHO THIS PERSON IS
Profiles:
• Documentary filmmaker who wants a long-form project
• YouTube series producer (has produced multi-episode series with 100K+ views)
• Reality TV producer who wants to do something they're proud of
• Podcast producer who wants to level up to video
• Film school grad who wants their first real production credit
• Agency creative director who wants to work on something meaningful
Career booster:
'I produced a docuseries documenting a DAO launch from Day 1.
200+ hours of content. Multiple cast members. Real story.',
'It's the most ambitious business documentary project I've seen.'
Comp: Equity (3-5%) + title (Series Producer) + portfolio rights
Time: 15-20 hrs/week. Full creative authority over the series. Reports to Nilo.
